result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc Anthony Estrada was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
*Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and fees by 8/25/2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 59 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc Anthony Estrada

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 59 days time served.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and fees by 8/25/2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment/tax intercept.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 21

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Marc Anthony Estrada not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case recalled at 9:25 am.
Defendant in custody not produced, appearance waived.  Case calendared for plea hearing.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Marc Anthony Estrada not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Marc Anthony Estrada not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for bail bond hearing. Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for bail bond hearing in Branch 21.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court orders defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing 

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm
  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davis, Branch 21.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj

Attorney Danielle L. Shelton in court previously.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Due to defense unavailability, court ordered case adjourned for Status Conference. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court with attorney Francisco Araiza for Danielle L. Shelton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Attorney Shelton in trial on another case.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status of Counsel scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned for Status Conference at request of defense counsel. Defendant reminded to comply with all conditions of bail. Case adjourned for a Status Conference to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Entry made without court file.  Defendant qualifies for Public Defender representation. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 07-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant states he does not want a public defender

Defendant Marc Anthony Estrada in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.45.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6-26-2015 at 1:30pm
